hero.title: Decentralised naming for wallets, websites, & more.

portableUsername.title: Your web3 username
portableUsername.text: No more sandboxed usernames. Own your username, store an avatar and other profile data, and use it across services.

cryptocurrencies.title: One Name For All of Your Addresses
cryptocurrencies.text: No more copying and pasting long addresses. Use your ĐNS name to store all of your addresses and receive any cryptocurrency, token, or NFT.

statistics.title: ĐNS is the most widely integrated blockchain naming standard on DogeChain.

decentralisedWebsites.title: Decentralised Websites
decentralisedWebsites.text: Launch censorship-resistant decentralised websites with ĐNS. Upload your website to IPFS and access it with your ĐNS name.

dns.title: Use Traditional Domains
dns.text1: The native name suffix for ĐNS is .doge, which has the full security benefits of being blockchain-native.
dns.text2: You can also use ĐNS with DNS names you already own. ĐNS supports most DNS names, including:

additionalFeatures.title: Additional Features
additionalFeatures.recordType: Create your project’s own record type.
additionalFeatures.textRecord: Attach profile information to your ĐNS name with text records.
additionalFeatures.subDomains: Create ĐNS subdomains as usernames for your project.
additionalFeatures.dns: Store and serve traditional DNS records with certain names.
additionalFeatures.tor: Use ĐNS to more easily access Tor .onion hidden services.

about.hero: The Đoge Name Service is an open source blockchain-based naming protocol.

aboutLNS.title: About ĐNS
aboutLNS.text: ĐNS forked from LNS onto DogeChain with a focus on decentralization, inexpensive fees, and robust tokenomics. ĐNS development is led by mainnet_pat and is a public good, a basic piece of Internet infrastructure that belongs to the community. We welcome all feedback and contributions!
aboutLNS.support: We have received generous financial support from:
aboutLNS.support2: Representatives of ĐNS participate in the greater Internet community:

root.title: Managing the ĐNS root
root.text: To facilitate the possibility of upgrades and maintenance, the ĐNS root is controlled by a four of seven multisig, with members of related projects as keyholders. In the long term, we would like the root multisig to be replaced by some form of distributed decision making process, as such systems become available.
